intro: Tetrastigma philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine crossvine, is a climbing vine native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
